extendedIngredients.name: black olives
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (2.5 Oz.) Can Sliced Black Olives, drained

extendedIngredients.name: chili beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (16 Oz.) Can Mild Chili Beans, undrained

extendedIngredients.name: fire roasted tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (14.5 Oz.) Can Fire Roasted DIced Tomatoes

extendedIngredients.name: ground beef
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 Lbs. Ground Beef (may use ground turkey)

extendedIngredients.name: refried beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (16 Oz.) Can Refried Beans (I used Rosarita Brand)

extendedIngredients.name: salsa
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup Thick And Chunky Salsa (I used mild)

extendedIngredients.name: taco seasoning mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 (1 Oz.) Packets Low Sodium Taco Seasoning Mix

extendedIngredients.name: whole kernel corn
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (15.25 Oz.) Can Whole Kernel Corn, drained

recipes.title: Crock-Pot Three Bean Taco Chili

winePairing.pairingText: Cava, Grenache, and Shiraz are my top picks for Chili. These juicy reds don't have too much tannin (important for spicy foods), but a sparkling wine like cava can tame the heat even better. The Campo Viejo Cava Brut ros√© with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Campo Viejo Cava Brut Rose
productMatches.description: A bright sparkling pink color. Pleasant and powerful on the nose with a strong presence of ripe red berries.With has a rounded, pleasant feel in the mouth.

recipes.instructions: In a large skillet brown the ground beef along with the diced onion, crumbling the beef as you cook it, until the beef is no longer pink.Drain and rinse the beef and pour into a 6 quart crock-pot.Add the rest of the ingredients and stir to combine.Cover and cook on low 6-8 hours or on high 4-5 hours.Serve with your favorite chili/taco toppings such as shredded cheese, sour cream, etc.

steps.step: In a large skillet brown the ground beef along with the diced onion, crumbling the beef as you cook it, until the beef is no longer pink.
Drain and rinse the beef and pour into a 6 quart crock-pot.
Add the rest of the ingredients and stir to combine.Cover and cook on low 6-8 hours or on high 4-5 hours.
Serve with your favorite chili/taco toppings such as shredded cheese, sour cream, etc.
